summary: Worker fails to start in ARM64 Docker containers due to a missing symbol (__register_atfork) in the core-bridge native module. The issue was resolved by using a non-Alpine Linux distribution (e.g., Bullseye) instead of musl-based distributions.
userImpact: Users cannot deploy Temporal workers to ARM64 Docker containers using Alpine or other musl-based Linux distributions, preventing containerization on modern M-series Macs and ARM servers.
rootCause: The core-bridge native module is compiled for glibc and requires the __register_atfork symbol which is not available in musl libc implementations used by Alpine Linux.
workaround: Use a glibc-based Linux distribution such as Debian Bullseye instead of Alpine for the Docker image.
resolutionDetails: Resolved by switching from Alpine (musl) to Bullseye (glibc) Docker image as per the supported platforms documentation.
keyQuote: Is your Docker image based on Alpine, or another muslc distro? That is not supported.
